author: zahary.
content:
<@!203220829473996800>, is the server expected to return mainnet data to match the test vectors? I see some requests that won't have deterministic results. For example `GET /eth/v1/beacon/blocks/head`:

https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-api-test-vectors/blob/master/tests/beacon/blocks/get_block.json#L40-L50

author: protolambda
content: <@!553610810652622860> they are mostly to generate bindings for API clients. It doesn't really matter much which head. Mine were using mainnet. Afraid some vectors can't be consistent due to ever-changing things (peers, head, etc.)

author: protolambda
content: See readme of the project (edit: both vectors and the generator), I go through the differences in server/client testing

author: zahary.
content: I see. Doesn't the official API also publish a JSON Schema that can be used for the same purpose (i.e. to validate that the response conforms to the expected structure and data types)?

author: protolambda
content: Kind of, but all the mock responses are not real enough IMHO. Wanted different behaviors based on query inputs too.

author: protolambda
content: And think it's a good start to hit every API endpoint with different query params, and have at least some checks on the results (expected status code). That's already more than what the eth2-comply tool offers
